intro: Astragalus caspius, commonly known as the Caspian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus caspius is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
